identificationModule.briefTitle: Comparison of the Safety of Absorbable and Hem-o-lok Clips in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Clinical Outcomes of Absorbable or Hem-o-lok Clip Closure of the Cystic Stump in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy: a Prospective Randomised Clinical Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Kartal Kosuyolu Yuksek Ihtisas Education and Research Hospital

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Safe closure of the cystic duct is the critical step in laparoscopic cholecystectomy. In the literature, the investigators did not observe any prospective study analysing the use of absorbable single clip and Hem-o-lok single clip. In this prospective study, the reliability of the two methods will be compared using a single clip.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: In this prospective randomised controlled clinical study; closure of the cystic duct in laparoscopic cholecystectomy will be performed by two different methods. Early clinical results and long-term effects on neighbouring anatomical structures will be investigated.

armGroups.label: Single absorbable
armGroups.description: Cystic duct to be closed with absorbable single clip

armGroups.label: Single Hem-o-lok
armGroups.description: Cystic duct to be closed with Hem-o-lok single clip

primaryOutcomes.measure: Complications of patients using absorbable and haem-olok clips will be compared according to the Clavien-Dindo scoring system.
primaryOutcomes.description: Is it safe to close the cystic stump with a single (haem-o-lok or absorbable) clip?

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The costs of the clips used
secondaryOutcomes.description: The costs of the clips used will be determined in dollars using Student's t-test.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy ASA I-III Patients who accepted the study

Exclusion Criteria:

* open surgery emergency cholecystectomy refuse to trial
